required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Open-label, Phase II Study of Stomatitis Prevention With a Steroid-based Mouthwash in Post-menopausal Women With Estrogen-receptor-positive (ER+), Human Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor 2 (HER2)- Metastatic or Locally Advanced Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II, Single Arm Study of the Use of Steroid-based Mouthwash to Prevent Stomatitis in Postmenopausal Women With Advanced or Metastatic Hormone Receptor Positive Breast Cancer Being Treated With Everolimus Plus Exemestane

brief_summary.textblock: Open-label, Phase II study of Stomatitis prevention with a steroid-based mouthwash in Post-menopausal women with ER+, HER2- Metastatic or Locally Advanced Breast Cancer

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Stomatitis Grade ≥ 2
primary_outcome.description: The incidence of grade ≥ 2 stomatitis was reported. Grade 1 = minimal symptoms, normal diet; grade 2 = symptomatic, but able to swallow a modified diet; grade 3 = symptomatic and unable to aliment or hydrate orally; and grade 4 = symptoms associated with life-threatening consequences.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Resolution of Stomatitis From Grade 2 or Greater to Grade 1 or Less
secondary_outcome.description: The number of days to achieve resolution of stomatitis from grade 2 or greater to grade 1 or less was assessed. Grade 1 = minimal symptoms, normal diet; grade 2 = symptomatic, but able to swallow a modified diet; grade 3 = symptomatic and unable to aliment or hydrate orally; and grade 4 = symptoms associated with life-threatening consequences.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Number of Mouthwashes Per Day
secondary_outcome.description: The median number of mouthwashes per day was assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With All Grades of Stomatitis
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants with all grades of stomatitis was defined as the number of participants who had stomatitis grade 1 or higher. Grade 1 = minimal symptoms, normal diet; grade 2 = symptomatic, but able to swallow a modified diet; grade 3 = symptomatic and unable to aliment or hydrate orally; and grade 4 = symptoms associated with life-threatening consequences.

secondary_outcome.measure: Dose Intensity of Everolimus and Exemestane
secondary_outcome.description: The dose intensity was calculated as the cumulative dose of everolimus or exemestane divided by the length of time on treatment during the first 56 days of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Blood Concentration of Everolimus and Exemestane
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples were collected and analyzed.

arm_group.description: Participants swished and spat 10mL of 0.5mg/5mL dexamethasone steroid mouthwash (investigational treatment) 4 times daily (qid) orally for 2 minutes each for 8 weeks. Participants remained without food or drink (NPO) for one hour after administration of the mouthwash. Also, participants received everolimus 10 mg and exemstane 25 mg (study treatments) according to local regulations.

intervention.description: Dexamethasone steroid-based oral solution, comprised of 0.5 milligrams per 5mL of alcohol-free dexamethasone.
Commercially available everolimus 10 mg was prescribed to participants by the Investigator according to local regulations.
Commercially available exemestane 25 mg was prescribed to participants by the Investigator according to local regulations.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 92 participants were enrolled into the study and received study treatments of everolimus and exemestane. Of these, 86 participants were confirmed to have also received the investigational treatment of dexamethasone steroid mouthwash and comprised the full analysis set (FAS). The patient disposition is based on the FAS.

group.title: Dexamethasone Based Mouthwash
group.description: Participants swished and spat 10mL of 0.5mg/5mL dexamethasone steroid mouthwash (investigational treatment) 4 times daily (qid) orally for 2 minutes each for 8 weeks. Participants remained without food or drink (NPO) for one hour after administration of the mouthwash. Also, participants received everolimus 10 mg and exemstane 25 mg (study treatments) according to local regulations.

baseline.population: Full analysis set: The full analysis set consisted of all participants who received at least one dose of study treatment (everolimus and/or exemestane) and at least one dose of investigational treatment (dexamethasone mouth wash).

group.title: Dexamethasone Based Mouthwash

Participants remained without food or drink (NPO) for one hour after administration of the mouthwash. Also, participants received everolimus 10 mg and exemstane 25 mg (study treatments) according to local regulations.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Stomatitis Grade ≥ 2
outcome.description: The incidence of grade ≥ 2 stomatitis was reported. Grade 1 = minimal symptoms, normal diet; grade 2 = symptomatic, but able to swallow a modified diet; grade 3 = symptomatic and unable to aliment or hydrate orally; and grade 4 = symptoms associated with life-threatening consequences.
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS): The FAS consisted of all participants who received at least one dose of study treatment (everolimus and/or exemestane) and at least one dose of investigational treatment (dexamethasone mouth wash).

group.title: Dexamethasone Based Mouthwash

Participants remained without food or drink (NPO) for one hour after administration of the mouthwash. measure.title: Number of Participants With Stomatitis Grade ≥ 2
measure.description: The incidence of grade ≥ 2 stomatitis was reported. Grade 1 = minimal symptoms, normal diet; grade 2 = symptomatic, but able to swallow a modified diet; grade 3 = symptomatic and unable to aliment or hydrate orally; and grade 4 = symptoms associated with life-threatening consequences.
measure.population: Full analysis set (FAS): The FAS consisted of all participants who received at least one dose of study treatment (everolimus and/or exemestane) and at least one dose of investigational treatment (dexamethasone mouth wash).

analysis.groups_desc: A test of the incidence rate R was performed with null hypothesis H0: R>= 0.33 and alternative hypothesis Ha: R<0.33 with a one-sided significance level of 0.05. If the test statistic was negative (actual incidence rate was <0.33), the one-sided p-value for the null hypothesis R>=0.33 was presented. The null hypothesis was rejected if the statistic was negative and the corresponding p-value for the one-sided test was <0.5.

outcome.title: Time to Resolution of Stomatitis From Grade 2 or Greater to Grade 1 or Less
outcome.description: The number of days to achieve resolution of stomatitis from grade 2 or greater to grade 1 or less was assessed. Grade 1 = minimal symptoms, normal diet; grade 2 = symptomatic, but able to swallow a modified diet; grade 3 = symptomatic and unable to aliment or hydrate orally; and grade 4 = symptoms associated with life-threatening consequences.
outcome.population: FAS: The FAS consisted of all participants who received at least one dose of study treatment (everolimus and/or exemestane) and at least one dose of investigational treatment (dexamethasone mouth wash).

measurement_list.measurement: Median could not be calculated due to insufficient number of participants with events.

measure.title: Median Number of Mouthwashes Per Day
measure.description: The median number of mouthwashes per day was assessed.
measure.population: FAS: The FAS set consisted of all participants who received at least one dose of study treatment (everolimus and/or exemestane) and at least one dose of investigational treatment (dexamethasone mouth wash).

outcome.title: Number of Participants With All Grades of Stomatitis
outcome.description: The number of participants with all grades of stomatitis was defined as the number of participants who had stomatitis grade 1 or higher. Grade 1 = minimal symptoms, normal diet; grade 2 = symptomatic, but able to swallow a modified diet; grade 3 = symptomatic and unable to aliment or hydrate orally; and grade 4 = symptoms associated with life-threatening consequences.
outcome.population: The FAS, consisting of all participants who received at least one dose of study treatment (everolimus and/or exemestane) and at least one dose of investigational treatment (dexamethasone mouth wash), was considered for the analysis. However, only those participants, who were evaluable for stomatitis grade, were analyzed.

outcome.title: Blood Concentration of Everolimus and Exemestane
outcome.description: Blood samples were collected and analyzed.
outcome.population: The PK analysis set, which was a subset of the FAS, was considered for the analysis. However, only participants who had evaluable data were analyzed.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The terms and conditions of Novartis' agreements with its investigators may vary. However, Novartis does not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Any publications from a single-site are postponed until the publication of the pooled data (i.e., data from all sites) in the clinical trial or disclosure of trial results in their entirety.
